fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A monoidal functor is said to be strong if \phi ^{2} and \phi ^{1} are isomorphisms.

fr:ul.fr:li: An underlying functor { F }:{ \mathsf { C } } \to { \mathsf { D } }.
A natural transformation { \phi ^{2} _{ X , Y } }:{ FX \otimes FY } \to { F(X \otimes Y) }.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: These data are subject to the following axioms.
